Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class ClassMethods

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.ClassMethods
public class ClassMethods extends Object
Methods for inspecting types.

  • Method Details

    • cast

      public static <T, R> R cast(T obj)
      Performs a brute-force cast to <R> of the specified object. Mainly meant to be used as a method reference. The argument is allowed to be null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object
      R - The type to case it to
      Parameters:
      obj - The object whose type to cast
      Returns:
      An instance of type <R>

    • isA

      public static boolean isA(Object instance, Class<?> superOrInterface)
      Tests whether the 1st argument is an instance of the specified class or interface. Equivalent to superOrInterface.isInstance(instance). Since this method is overloaded with Class as the type of the first parameter, you cannot and should not use this method to test whether a Class object itself is an instance of something (even though it is, for example, an instance of Serializable).
      Parameters:
      instance - The object to test
      superOrInterface - The class or interface to test the object against
      Returns:
      Whether the 1st argument is an instance of the 2nd argument

    • isA

      public static boolean isA(Class<?> clazz, Class<?> superOrInterface)
      Tests whether the first class extends or implements the second class. In case you keep forgetting what "assignable from" even means. Equivalent to superOrInterface.isAssignableFrom(classToTest).
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to test
      superOrInterface - The class or interface to test the class against
      Returns:
      Whether the 1st argument extends or implements the 2nd argument

    • isPrimitiveNumber

      public static boolean isPrimitiveNumber(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns whether the specified class is one of the primitive number classes. Note that this does not include char.class, just like Character does not extend Number.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to test
      Returns:
      Whether the specified class is one of the primitive number classes

    • isNumerical

      public static boolean isNumerical(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns whether the specified class is a primitive number or extends Number (including Number itself).
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to test
      Returns:
      Whether the specified class is a primitive number or extends Number

    • isPrimitiveArray

      public static boolean isPrimitiveArray(Object obj)
      Returns whether the specified object is a primitive array or a Class object representing a primitive array. Defers to isPrimitiveArray(Class) if the specified object is a Class object.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to test
      Returns:
      Whether it is a primitive array class

    • isPrimitiveArray

      public static boolean isPrimitiveArray(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns whether the class is a primitive array class.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to test
      Returns:
      Whether it is a primitive array class

    • isPrimitiveNumberArray

      public static boolean isPrimitiveNumberArray(Object obj)
      Returns whether the specified object is a primitive number array or a Class object representing a primitive number array. Defers to isPrimitiveNumberArray(Class) if the specified object is a Class object.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to test
      Returns:
      Whether it is a primitive array class

    • isPrimitiveNumberArray

      public static boolean isPrimitiveNumberArray(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns whether the specified class represents an array of primitive numbers.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to test
      Returns:
      Whether it is a primitive array class

    • isNumericalArray

      public static boolean isNumericalArray(Object obj)
      Returns whether the specified object is an array of a numerical type or a Class object representing an array of a numerical type.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to test
      Returns:
      Whether it is an array of a #isNumerical numerical type or a Class object representing an array of a numerical type

    • isNumericalArray

      public static boolean isNumericalArray(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns whether the specified class represents an array of a numerical type.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to test
      Returns:
      whether it represents an array of a numerical type

    • isWrapper

      public static boolean isWrapper(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns whether the specified is one of the primitive wrapper classes.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to test
      Returns:
      Whether the specified is one of the primitive wrapper classes

    • isAutoUnboxedAs

      public static boolean isAutoUnboxedAs(Class<?> classToTest, Class<?> primitiveClass)
      Returns whether instances of the first class will be auto-unboxed into instances of the second class. This method does not check whether the first class actually is a wrapper class and the second a primitive class. If either is not true, the method will return false.
      Parameters:
      classToTest - The class to test
      primitiveClass - Supposedly a primitively class
      Returns:
      Whether instances of the first class will be auto-unboxed into instances of the second class

    • isAutoBoxedAs

      public static boolean isAutoBoxedAs(Class<?> classToTest, Class<?> wrapperClass)
      Returns whether instances of the first class will be auto-unboxed into instances of the second class. This method does not check whether the first class actually is a wrapper class and the second a primitive class. If either is not true, the method will return false.
      Parameters:
      classToTest - The class to test
      wrapperClass - Supposedly a wrapper class
      Returns:
      Whether instances of the first class will be auto-unboxed into instances of the second class

    • box

      public static Class<?> box(Class<?> clazz)
      If the specified class is a primitive type, returns the corresponding primitive wrapper class, else the specified class itself.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The (primitive) class
      Returns:
      The corresponding wrapper class

    • unbox

      public static Class<?> unbox(Class<?> clazz)
      If the specified class is a primitive wrapper class, returns the corresponding primitive type, else the specified class itself.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The (wrapper) class
      Returns:
      The corresponding primitive class

    • getAncestors

      public static List<Class<?>> getAncestors(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns the superclasses of the specified class up to, and including Object.class.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class for which to get the superclasses
      Returns:
      The superclasses of the specified class.

    • countAncestors

      public static int countAncestors(Class<?> clazz)

    • getAllInterfaces

      public static Set<Class<?>> getAllInterfaces(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns the entire interface hierarchy, both "horizontal" amd "vertical", associated with specified class or interface. Returns an empty set if the argument is a top-level interface, or if the class is a regular class that does not implement any interface (either directly, or indirectly)and neither directly nor indirectly through its superclasses).
      Parameters:
      clazz - The Class object for which to retrieve the interface hierarchy
      Returns:
      The interface hierarchy for the specified Class object

    • className

      public static String className(Object obj)
      Returns a prettified version of the fully-qualified class name. If the argument is an array, arrayClassName(Object) is returned, else obj.getClass().getName().
      Parameters:
      obj - The object whose class name to return
      Returns:
      The class name

    • className

      public static String className(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns a prettified version of the fully-qualified class name. If the argument is an array class, arrayClassName(Object) is returned, else obj.getClass().getName().
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class whose name to return
      Returns:
      The class name

    • simpleClassName

      public static String simpleClassName(Object obj)
      Returns a prettified version of the simple class name. If the argument is an array, arrayClassSimpleName(Object) is returned, else obj.getClass().getSimpleName().
      Parameters:
      obj - The object whose class name to return
      Returns:
      The class name

    • simpleClassName

      public static String simpleClassName(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns a prettified version of the simple class name. If the argument is an array class, arrayClassSimpleName(Class) is returned, else obj.getClass().getSimpleName().
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class whose ame to return
      Returns:
      The class name

    • arrayClassName

      public static String arrayClassName(Object array)
      Returns a description for the specified array that is a bit easier on they eye than what you get from Class.getName(). For example arrayClassName(new String[0][0]) will return java.lang.String[][].
      Parameters:
      array - The array
      Returns:
      A more intuitive description of the array's type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is not an array

    • arrayClassName

      public static String arrayClassName(Class<?> arrayClass)
      Returns a description for the specified array class that is a bit easier on they eye than what you get from Class.getName().
      Parameters:
      arrayClass - The array type
      Returns:
      A more intuitive description of the array type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is not an array class

    • arrayClassSimpleName

      public static String arrayClassSimpleName(Object array)
      Returns a short description for the specified array that is a bit easier on they eye than what you get from Class.getSimpleName(). For example arrayClassName(new String[0][0]) will return String[][].
      Parameters:
      array - The array
      Returns:
      The simple name of the array type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is not an array

    • arrayClassSimpleName

      public static String arrayClassSimpleName(Class<?> arrayClass)
      Returns a short description for the specified array class that is a bit easier on they eye than what you get from Class.getSimpleName().
      Parameters:
      arrayClass - The array type
      Returns:
      An intuitive description of the array type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is not an array class
